data.title: Most sources cite one Otto I Gf von Scheyern (d
data.text:
Egilmar I, Gf in Lerigau ca 1091-1108 left issue by his wife Richeza: a daughter, Gertrud; a son, Christian, Gf 1108; and another son, Gf Egilmar II (d.by 1145), who in turn left issue by his wife Eilika von Rietberg:

Part 2

Dietrich Gf von Oldenburg u.Delmenhorst and his 2d wife, Hedwig of Schleswig and Holstein (see Part 1) had issue:

1.Christian; became King Christian I of Denmark and Norway 1448; Gf von Oldenburg, Duke of Schleswig and Holstein (1426-Copenhagen 21 May 1481); m.Copenhagen 28 Oct 1449 Dorothea of Brandenburg (1430-Kalundborg 10 Nov 1495); for their descendants see Part 3

2.Moritz IV Gf von Delmenhorst (1428-d.of the plague 9 Aug 1464); m.22 Feb 1458 Katharina von Hoya (d.1465)

2.2.Hedwig, a nun in Blankenburg, b.ca 1463

4.1.1.1.3.1.1.2.1.3.1.2.1.[by Elsa Maria Guldberg Poulsen] Frederik Carl Christian (21 Nov 1843- ) à issue; see this note on Nobiliana Forum 13 Nov 2009: It didnt pass unnoticed when Gete Bondo Oldenborg Maaløe published her memoirs some weeks ago. She claims to be a great-granddaughter of the officially childless King Frederik VII of Denmark. He acknowledged having a son by his mistress in old letters that are now in the possession of Mrs. Maaløe, and the story seems credible  also because of other circumstances. You can read more about it here and see pictures of Mrs. Maaløe:

http://trondni.blogs...n-revealed.html

http://politiken.dk/...ticle802125.ece

http://foto.jp.dk/ft...re/res_5104.jpg

I have tried to extract some genealogical facts from her book, which has the long title "Getes Erindringer  Slægtshistorie, erindringer og beretning om et 'jævnt og (for det meste) muntert, (altid) virkomt liv'"

http://www.forlageta.../book.php?id=68

Unfortunately, it contains as good as no dates, but I have found some additional facts in a genealogical internet forum, where people have posted information from old church books and censuses.

http://www.dis-danma...orum/read.php?1,583168,583299

Text in black is from the book; text in blue is from the internet forum.

Crown Prince Frederik (VII) of Denmark had a relationship with Else Maria Guldberg Poulsen, born c. 1820/1821. She was later married  on 29 April 1845  to Peter Larsen Rasmussen, born c. 1811-1812.

1. Frederik Carl Christian Poulsen, born 21 November 1843. Married 3 May 1872 to Hansigne Louise Aakerberg, born c. 1842/1843. They died within three months, when their granddaughter Else Margrethe ("Gete") Bondo Oldenborg Poulsen was seven years old. Buried at the cemetery in Skælskør.

1.1. Ellen Kirstine Louise Frederikke, born c. 1873/1874. Unmarried. Buried at the cemetery in Skælskør.

1.2. Poul Frederik Oldenborg Poulsen, born c. 1877/1878. Died two days after his daughter Getes first wedding. Buried at the cemetery in Hellerup. He was married to Nelly Bondo  daughter of Caspar Vilhelm Bondo (28 Sept 1848  22 May 1918) and Caroline Mathilde Larsen (6 June 1853  20 Sept 1924).

1.2.1. Else Margrethe ("Gete") Bondo Oldenborg Poulsen, born in Ringsted. No children. She has been married twice, and her two husbands were second cousins:

[1st] 25 June 19xx in Skovshoved Church to Valdemar Urban Maaløe, who had been married once or twice before and had a daughter. Divorced.

[2nd] in 1954(?) in Taarnby Church to Carl Adolph Saabye Maaløe, born 17 August xxxx, died 1982 at the hospital in Holbæk. Son of Lauritz Maaløe and Annette Saabye. He had been married three times before and had a son from his first marriage.

1.2.2. Inger Bondo Oldenborg Poulsen (✝). Born at Rigshospitalet in Copenhagen; five years younger than her sister. She later changed her name to Inger Oldenborg Bondo. Married four times:

[1st] to Emil Rottbøll Poulsen. Divorced. No children.

[2nd] to Niels Peer Friis. Divorced. No children.

[3rd] to Arne Sigvartsen, wedding in Taarnby Church. Divorced. One son:

1.2.2.1. Søren Bondo Oldenborg Sigvartsen. He later changed his name to Søren Oldenborg Bondo. Married to Jytte Wilhelms, born 18 August 19xx.

[4th] to Einar Olsen (✝). One son:

1.2.2.2. Jens Bondo Oldenborg Olsen. He later changed his name to Jens Oldenborg Bondo. Engaged to Annette.
